author: Staff Reporter
text:
Officials demonstrating Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) system to the public at Anna Bus stand in Thoothukudi on Friday.— Photo: N. Rajesh

Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail system (VVPAT), a new facility to be introduced during the May 16 Assembly elections, was demonstrated at Thoothukudi Old Bus Stand on Friday.

In the presence of Collector and District Election Officer M. Ravikumar, election officials demonstrated the functioning of VVPAT to the public.

After casting their vote, the voters would have an opportunity to see the name of the contestant along with the serial number and symbol of parties they had voted.

They would be displayed on the VVPAT for seven seconds after voting. The VVPAT was attached to the control unit of electronic voting machine during the demonstration.

As per a Election Commission directive, VVPAT would be established in 245 polling booths out of the total 271 booths in Thoothukudi Assembly constituency.

More on the anvil

More familiarisation programmes would be organised at bus stands, colleges and other public places till March 30, Mr. Ravikumar added. Thoothukudi Sub Collector and Returning Officer S. Gopala Sundara Raj and Thoothukudi Tahsildar S. Chandran were present.
title: Voters familiarised with VVPAT system
